newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan stocks higher in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Jordan stocks higher in thin trade.

text.p: Amman stocks ended floor trade on Sunday higher in thin transactions propped up by the strength of Arab Bank, a major component of the official index.
The Amman Financial Market 60-share index rose 0.34 points to 147.22 points in low trade worth 318,069 dinars ($449,250).
Eighteen stocks fell, twelve rose and eleven traded but closed unchanged.

The market has been depressed by an impasse in Palestinian- Israeli talks and growing fears that neighbouring Iraq, Jordan's biggest trading partner, will be unable to sell oil under a limited UN deal before the end of the year.

The index for bank shares rose 0.53 percent. It was bolstered by market heavy weight Arab Bank, a major component in the official index, which rose 1.50 dinars to 244 dinars despite a low 240 share turnover.

In industrials, speculative trade on Livestock and Poultry LIPO, continued to dominate trade, in otherwise lacklustre performance by most stocks with investors still on the sidelines in a wait-and-see-mood over prospects of a breakthrough in Midde East peace talks.
LIPO rose 0.20 dinars to 0.670 dinars, with 62,375 shares changing hands.
The private Pearl Investable Index of the 45 best performing shares on the exchange rose 0.18 percent to 80.68 points from 80.54 points on Saturday, 15.52 percent down from the same time last year.
A total of 132,000 shares worth 80,100 dinars changed hands in poor trade in the parallel market. Of 18 shares traded, five advanced, seven declined and six were unchanged.
